p: The major compounds of the EOs in the needles were α-pinene and δ-3-carene, in the twigs the main compounds were δ-3-carene, limonene and β-pinene, while in cone EOs the major components were ( E)-caryophyllene and δ-3-carene. The EOs of the twigs of all three Pinus spp. and the cones of P. mugo showed the most significant anti-inflammatory activity in LPS-stimulated macrophages. The EOs of the needles and twigs from P. peuce and P. mugo, as well as the needles of P. heldreichii, exerted the strongest cytotoxic activity on HeLa and CaCo-2 cell lines. On MCF-7 cell lines, the highest activity was shown by P. peuce (twigs and needles) and P. mugo needles. These EOs should be considered as potential agents for the development of new phytotherapeutic anticancer medicine.
